attributes.action: Use Parliament's powers to prevent the UK from leaving the European Union
attributes.additional_details:
A slim majority was gained in a non-binding referendum based on people voting for unachievable ideals, promises and misconceptions, and not practical planning and consequences. Many have expressed their regret based on the short and long-term prospects that are already now apparent.

Historically a number of key referenda with close results have not been enacted, as the most popular option was seen to be unworkable. These led to a second vote or parliament acting for the greater good.
attributes.background:
Parliament should use its powers to halt the UK exiting the European Union as the consequences will be so negative as to greatly outweigh any benefits.

I call on you, my elected Parliamentary representatives to do the right and sensible thing, and protect the UK from years of avoidable harm.
